definition: Bauhaus (German school of modern architecture and design)
to cover/to wrap/to hold/to include/to take charge of/to contract (to or for)/package/wrapper/container/bag/to hold or embrace/bundle/packet/CL:個|个[ge4],隻|只[zhi1]
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]

sentences.english: The Wang Wen in bank hold office is Bao Hao this of furniture faithful embrace wholesale.
sentences.chinese: 在銀行供職的王文是包豪斯傢俱的忠實擁躉。

sentences.english: That is the genre what later called Bauhaus.
sentences.chinese: 這種學派後來被稱爲包豪斯學派。

sentences.english: Much in the same way one could not possibly fail to see the pupils of bauhaus during drachenfest.
sentences.chinese: 同樣地，他們也不可能不在風箏節看到包豪斯的學生。

sentences.english: The unity of art and technology is the core of Bauhaus's educational thinking.
sentences.chinese: 藝術與技術相統一是包豪斯教育思想的核心。

sentences.english: The architecture in Bauhaus style is a piece of art in itself.
sentences.chinese: 包豪斯風格的建築本身就是藝術品。

sentences.english: The Mayor of Dessau succeeded in securing the transfer of the Bauhaus to his town .
sentences.chinese: 德桑市長成功爭取到了包豪斯向他的城市轉移的機會。

pinyin: Fa3 lan2 ke4 fu2 Xue2 pai4

definition: Futurism (artistic and social movement of the 20th century)
